newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka buys 10,000 tonne Indian white raw rice.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka buys 10,000 tonne Indian white raw rice.

text.p: Sri Lanka's Cooperative Wholesale Establishment has bought 10,000 tonnes of Indian white raw rice at $273.50 per tonne, c and f free out Colombo, government officials said on Monday.
The state buying arm tendered for 30,000 tonnes of rice but only bought 10,000 due to high prices, they said.
The purchase was from the State Trading Corp of India and delivery is due in the first week of October, the officials said. It will be the first government rice import this year.
"The price was high so the government decided to buy only 10,000 tonnes instead of the original tender for 30,000 tonnes," one official said.
The government has said Sri Lanka needs to import up to 500,000 tonnes of rice by the end of this year to meet an anticipated crop shortfall caused by drought and rising demand.
The private sector has already imported more than 100,000 tonnes in the first seven months of this year.
